subtitle: Why do I need regular check-ups?
title: Why do I need regular check-ups?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

When you are pregnant, it is a good idea to have regular check-ups by a nurse or midwife. It is best to have at least 4 visits while you are pregnant. Try to make the first visit for just after you missed your period. 

Here is why regular check-ups make sense:

•	At the check-up, a nurse or midwife will do tests to make sure that you and your baby are well. 

•	If there are problems when you are pregnant, your nurse or midwife will find them early. This will give you the best chance of getting the right treatment so you and your baby are healthy.

•	If you have questions about your pregnancy, your nurse or midwife is the best person to ask. She will answer your questions and will give you the right information.

•	You may be able to get free iron and folic acid tablets from your nurse or midwife. These tablets give you the strength to carry your baby and help your baby to grow well. 

•	You will feel reassured your baby is growing well.

Find out how to get to your nearest nurse or midwife. Talk to your family about why you need to visit regularly during pregnancy. Ask them for help if you need transport. 

If you are worried, ask a close friend or a family member to go with you. If it is a long way, you may want to carry some food and clean, safe water with you.
